primaryColors.shako: black with yellow band and brass plate

tunic.description: Double-breasted dark blue tunic with standing yellow collar and yellow cuffs
tunic.buttons: brass buttons arranged in two vertical rows

trousers.description: White or off-white trousers reaching to mid-calf, tucked into gaiters

headgear.description: Black shako with yellow band at base and front brass regimental plate
headgear.additional: Small cockade or plume optional depending on rank

equipment.crossBelts: Two brown leather crossbelts crossing at the chest
equipment.cartridgeBox: Black cartridge box worn on right hip
equipment.musket: Flintlock musket with bayonet fixed or shouldered

footwear.description: Black leather gaiters over low shoes

appearanceNotes.overallLook: Neat and disciplined; practical field appearance with minor wear from campaign conditions
appearanceNotes.material: Wool tunic, linen trousers, leather equipment
appearanceNotes.tone: Swedish-Finnish uniform style typical of early 19th century

tunic.description: Dark green single-breasted coat (dolman/kaftan variant depending on supply) with red collar and cuffs
tunic.buttons: brass buttons spaced down the front

trousers.description: White or light grey trousers, sometimes reinforced with patches or mud-stained from campaign use

headgear.description: Early-war Russian kiwer shako (or pre-kiwer bicorn in some units), black with brass front plate
headgear.additional: Small plume or pompon, usually in company color

equipment.crossBelts: Black leather crossbelt for cartridge box; bayonet scabbard on left side
equipment.cartridgeBox: Black leather with brass badge depending on regiment
equipment.musket: Flintlock musket (M1798 or similar), bayonet fixed in battle
equipment.backpack: Brown or black leather pack with rolled greatcoat on top

footwear.description: Black leather gaiters over low shoes; boots possible for NCOs

appearanceNotes.overallLook: Sturdy, campaign-worn appearance; Russian infantry often appeared slightly more rugged due to long marches and supply delays
appearanceNotes.material: Wool tunic, linen trousers, leather equipment
appearanceNotes.tone: Characteristic early 19th-century Russian infantry look: dark green massed ranks with red facings and tall shakos
